meanings.definition: A person who sells small items or food, typically in an aggressive or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The huckster at the market tried to push his cheap toys on unsuspecting customers.
meanings.sent2: The huckster set up a stand selling knockoff watches on the street corner.
meanings.sent3: The huckster's exaggerated claims about his products made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The huckster's sales pitch was like a carnival barker trying to lure in passersby.
meanings.sent5: The image of the huckster with his slick sales tactics stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To sell or promote something aggressively or dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: She decided to huckster her homemade jams at the local fair.
meanings.sent2: The company was caught huckstering their miracle weight-loss pills.
meanings.sent3: The street performer huckstered his magic tricks to the delight of the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The politician huckstering his promises to win votes in the election.
meanings.sent5: The salesman huckstered his way into convincing me to buy the unnecessary product.
